properties.Status: In June, the Miami Beach Design Review Board approved this project
properties.Caption: The Giller family plans a mixed-use project on the southeast corner of Alton Road and West 41st Street, with 28,200 square feet of offices on the top three levels.

properties.Developer: Sumaida + Khurana, Bizzi+Bilgili. Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt is a partner in the project.
properties.Status: Under construction. Completion is expected next year.
properties.Caption: Sumaida + Khurana and Bizzi+Bilgili are developing the five-story The Fifth Miami Beach, where nearly 20 percent of the 54,500 square feet of office space is preleased. Also, New York's high-end Italian restaurant Sant Ambroeus signed up for the dining space at the building. Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt is a partner in The Fifth Miami Beach.

properties.Status: On April 25, the Miami Beach Planning Board voted on the proposal.
properties.Caption: Sumaida + Khurana also plans a five-story building at 1100 Fifth Street in partnership with the property owners, Roslyn and Norton Nesis. Robert and Miriam Weiss of Weiss Properties, as well as Aaron Butler of Avenue Real Estate Partners also are partners in the project.

properties.Status: Shvo's planned five-story One Soundscape Park will be a 62,500-square-foot building at 1665 and 1667 Washington Avenue, near Soundscape Park.
properties.Caption: Shvo's planned five-story One Soundscape Park will be a 62,500-square-foot building at 1665 and 1667 Washington Avenue, near Soundscape Park.

properties.Status: It scored final approval in December.
properties.Caption: Shvo's six-story The Alton mixed-use building will include 170,000 square feet of offices and five apartments on the northwest corner of Alton and Lincoln roads.

properties.Developer: Wayne M. Boich, Bruce Beal and Andrew Mathias
properties.Caption: Wayne M. Boich, in partnership with Bruce Beal and Andrew Mathias, plans a six-story mixed-use building with offices at 1920 Alton Road in the Sunset Harbour neighborhood.

properties.Developer: Deco Capital Group, led by Bradley Colmer, and RWN Real Estate Partners, part of billionaire Marc Rowan’s family office
properties.Caption: Deco Capital Group and RWN Real Estate Partners’ mixed-use Eighteen Sunset in Sunset Harbour, where nearly all of the office space is spoken for. A tenant is expected to soon sign up for the last remaining office, a source said.
